metal M is :

questions.question_text:
Let $$f$$ be a real-valued function defined on the interval $$\left( {0,\infty } \right)$$ 

by $$\,f\left( x \right) = \ln x + \int\limits_0^x {\sqrt {1 + \sin t\,} dt.} $$ then which of the following 

statement(s) is (are) true?

option_texts.B: $$f'(x)$$ exists for all $$x \in \left( {0,\infty } \right)$$ and $$f'$$ is continuous on $$\left( {0,\infty } \right)$$, but not differentiable on $$\left( {0,\infty } \right)$$
option_texts.C: there exists $$\,\,\alpha  > 1$$ such that $$\left| {f'\left( x \right)} \right| < \left| {f\left( x \right)} \right|$$ for all $$x \in \left( {\alpha ,\infty } \right)\,$$
option_texts.D: there exists $$\beta  > 0$$ such that $$\left| {f\left( x \right)} \right| + \left| {f'\left( x \right)} \right| \le \beta $$ for all $$x \in \left( {0,\infty } \right)$$

A block of mass m is on an inclined plane of angle θ. The coefficient of
friction between the block and the plane is μ and tan θ > μ. The block is held
stationary by applying a force P parallel to the plane. The direction of force
pointing up the plane is taken to be positive. As P is varied from P1 =
mg(sinθ − μ cosθ) to P2 = mg(sinθ + μ cosθ), the frictional force f versus P
graph will look like

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A point mass of 1 kg collides elastically with a stationary point mass of 5 kg. After their collision, the 1 kg
mass reverses its direction and moves with a speed of 2 ms−1. Which of the following statement(s) is (are) correct for the system of these two masses?

option_texts.A: Total momentum of the system is 3 kg ms^{−1}
option_texts.B: Momentum of 5 kg mass after collision is 4 kg ms^{−1}
option_texts.C: Kinetic energy of the centre of mass is 0.75 J
option_texts.D: Total kinetic energy of the system is 4 J

of the total angular momentum of the binary star to the angular momentum of star B about the centre of
mass is

speed on the surface of the earth is taken to be 11 kms-1, the escape speed on the surface of the planet in

option_texts.A: pressure and temperature are both high
option_texts.B: pressure and temperature are both low

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two spherical bodies A (radius 6 cm ) and B (radius 18 cm ) are at temperature T1 and T2, respectively.
The maximum intensity in the emission spectrum of A is at 500 nm and in that of B is at 1500 nm.
Considering them to be black bodies, what will be the ratio of the rate of total energy radiated by A to that
of B?

ice-water mixture is in equilibrium, it is found that 1 gm of ice has melted. Assuming there is no other heat
exchange in the process, the value of m is

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A student uses a simple pendulum of exactly 1m length to determine g, the acceleration due to gravity. He
uses a stop watch with the least count of 1 sec for this and records 40 seconds for 20 oscillations. For this
observation, which of the following statement(s) is (are) true?

option_texts.A: Error ΔT in measuring T, the time period, is 0.05 seconds
option_texts.B: Error ΔT in measuring T, the time period, is 1 second
option_texts.C: Percentage error in the determination of g is 5%
option_texts.D: Percentage error in the determination of g is 2.5%

questions.subject: Physics

option_texts.A: Internal energies at A and B are the same.
option_texts.B: Work done by the gas in process AB is P_{0}V_{0} ln4.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A ray OP of monochromatic light is incident on the face AB of prism ABCD near vertex B at an incident angle of 60$$^\circ$$ (see figure). If the refractive index of the material of the prism is $$\sqrt3$$, which of the following is(are) correct?

option_texts.A: The ray gets totally internally reflected at face CD.
option_texts.B: The ray comes out through face AD.
option_texts.C: The angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray is 90$$^\circ$$.
option_texts.D: The angle between the incident ray and the emergent ray is 120$$^\circ$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A stationary source is emitting sound at a fixed frequency f0, which is reflected by two cars approaching the source. The difference between the frequencies of sound reflected from the cars is 1.2% of f0. What is the difference in the speeds of the cars (in km per hour) to the nearest integer? The cars are moving at constant speeds much smaller than the speed of sound which is 330 ms$$-$$1.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The focal length of a thin biconvex lens is 20 cm. When an object is moved from a distance of 25 cm in front of it to 50 cm, the magnification of its image changes from m25 to m50. The ratio $${{{m_{25}}} \over {{m_{50}}}}$$ is __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An $$\alpha$$-particle and a proton are accelerated from the rest by a potential difference of 100 V. After this, their de Broglie wavelengths are $$\lambda$$$$\alpha$$ and $$\lambda$$p, respectively. The ratio $${{{\lambda _p}} \over {{\lambda _\alpha }}}$$, to the nearest integer, is _____________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: When two identical batteries of internal resistance 1 $$\Omega$$ each are connected in series across a resistor R, the rate of heat produced in R is J1. When the same batteries are connected in parallel across R, the rate is J2. If J1 = 2.25 J2, then the value of R in $$\Omega$$ is __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: When two progressive waves $${y_1} = 4\sin (2x - 6t)$$ and $${y_2} = 3\sin \left( {2x - 6t - {\pi  \over 2}} \right)$$ are superimposed, the amplitude of the resultant wave is __________.
